item.title: 巴西国家石油公司通过炼油投资推动卢拉的经济议程
item.description: 巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）周四宣布，将在里约热内卢州投资约 300 亿雷亚尔（约合 55 亿美元）用于炼油和石化行业，这与巴西政府创造就业机会和加快经济增长的更广泛计划是一致的。【原文：Brazil’s state-controlled oil producer Petrobras announced on Thursday about 30 billion reais ($5.5 billion) in refining and petrochemicals investments in Rio de Janeiro state that align with the government’s wider plan to create jobs and accelerate economic growth.】

item.title: 与会代表称欧佩克+将于八月讨论增产 41.1 万桶石油
item.description: 据不愿透露姓名的代表称，欧佩克+组织已开始讨论在本周末召开视频会议之前，将 8 月份的日产量再提高 411,000 桶。【原文：OPEC+ has begun discussing another 411,000 barrel-a-day production increase for August ahead of the group’s video-conference this weekend, according to delegates who asked not to be identified.】

item.title: 贝莱德从比特币 ETF 中赚得盆满钵满
item.description:
它从现货比特币 ETF 中获得的收入超过了它从最大 ETF 中获得的收入

。【原文：

It’s generating more revenue from its spot Bitcoin ETF than it is from its largest ETF

】

item.title: 奥默斯-伊格诺集团与香港长江基建争夺英国谷物液化天然气终端项目
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，长江基建控股有限公司（CK Infrastructure Holdings Ltd.）和一个包括安大略市政雇员退休系统（Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System）在内的财团是国家电网公司（National Grid Plc）出售的欧洲最大液化天然气终端之一的最终竞标者。【原文：CK Infrastructure Holdings Ltd. and a consortium that includes Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System are the final bidders for one of Europe’s largest liquefied natural gas terminals being sold by National Grid Plc, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 海豚出售：破产的水上公园公司急需现金
item.description: 破产的水上乐园运营商海豚公司正准备出售数百头海豚和其他海洋哺乳动物，称该公司资金短缺，无力继续照顾其动物。【原文：Bankrupt aquatic parks operator The Dolphin Company is preparing to sell hundreds of dolphins and other marine mammals, saying the business is running low on cash and can’t afford to keep caring for its animals.】

item.title: SAP 首席执行官称欧洲需要更多应用人工智能，而不是另一个星际之门
item.description: 欧洲最有价值公司的首席执行官克里斯蒂安-克莱因（Christian Klein）表示，欧洲不需要大量增加数据中心来参与人工智能竞争，拒绝了英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.克莱因拒绝了英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：Christian Klein, the chief executive officer of Europe’s most valuable company, said that Europe doesn’t require a flurry of more data centers to compete in artificial intelligence, rejecting a narrative pushed by Nvidia Corp. CEO Jensen Huang on a trip to the continent last month.】

item.title: 孤松领衔的老虎幼崽对冲基金上半年收益强劲
item.description: 老虎管理公司（Tiger Management）创始人朱利安-罗伯逊（Julian Robertson）的弟子们经营的对冲基金 "老虎幼崽"（Tiger Cubs）是今年上半年表现最好的选股公司之一，6 月份更是取得了稳健的收益。【原文：A pack of stock-picking firms known as Tiger Cubs — the hedge funds run by proteges of Tiger Management founder Julian Robertson — were among the industry’s best performers in the first half of the year, capped by solid gains in June.】

item.title: 贝森特称特朗普将决定是否延长 7 月 9 日的关税期限
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将决定是否延长与贸易伙伴的谈判，使其超过 7 月 9 日的最后期限，以恢复较高的关税税率。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that President Donald Trump will make the call on any extension of talks with trading partners past the July 9 deadline for higher tariff rates to kick back in.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织警告特朗普税改法案使中期减债复杂化
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）警告说，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）即将于本周四最终通过的税收法案很可能会使美国未来几年减少财政赤字和债务负担的任务变得更加复杂。【原文：The International Monetary Fund warned that President Donald Trump’s tax bill nearing final passage on Thursday is likely to complicate the task of reducing the US fiscal deficit and debt burden in the coming years.】

item.title: 新加坡收紧房地产措施为房市降温
item.description: 新加坡出台新措施抑制房价，提高了四年内售房者的印花税。【原文：Singapore introduced fresh measures to tame housing prices, raising the stamp duty for those who sell their homes within four years.】

item.title: 系统故障导致电网瘫痪，津巴布韦全国停电
item.description: 周四，由于系统故障导致两个发电站停电，津巴布韦全国停电。【原文：Zimbabwe suffered a countrywide electricity outage on Thursday due to a system failure that resulted in loss of generation at its two power stations.】

item.title: 法官称 Archegos 员工有权获得 3300 万美元赔偿金
item.description: 一名联邦法官裁定，Archegos 资本管理公司的一批前雇员，包括一名曾与公司创始人 Bill Hwang 密切合作的分析师，因公司倒闭而蒙受损失，应获得 3300 万美元的赔偿。【原文：A federal judge ruled that a group of former Archegos Capital Management employees, including an analyst who worked closely with founder Bill Hwang, are owed $33 million for losses they suffered when the firm collapsed.】

item.title: 中国避开美国石油的时间为 2018 年以来最长
item.description: 中国连续第三个月避免购买美国原油，这是自2018年以来最长的一段时期，给已经面临油价下跌的页岩油钻探商带来了新的打击。【原文：China avoided purchasing US crude for the third straight month — the longest stretch since 2018 — delivering a fresh blow to shale drillers already facing lower oil prices.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率连续第五周下滑，跌至 6.67
item.description: 美国的抵押贷款利率降至 4 月初以来的最低水平。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US dropped to the lowest level since early April.】

item.title: Glencore 拥有陷入困境的英国炼油厂林赛的所有权条款
item.description: 大宗商品贸易巨头嘉能可集团（Glencore Plc）在其与普拉克斯林赛炼油厂有限公司（Prax Lindsey Oil Refinery Ltd.）的供应协议中有一项条款，规定如果欠债不还，嘉能可可控制其位于英格兰北部的炼油厂。【原文：Commodity trading giant Glencore Plc has a clause in its supply agreement with Prax Lindsey Oil Refinery Ltd. enabling it to take control of its facility in northern England if the debt it’s owed isn’t repaid.】

item.title: 英国债券牛市未受最新一轮市场动荡影响
item.description: 本周，当许多投资者为英国可能出现的财政不稳定而忧心忡忡时，一些投资者却看到了大量购买政府债券的机会。【原文：While many investors were fretting over the potential for UK fiscal instability this week, some saw an opportunity to load up on government bonds.】

item.title: 德国格拉斯法瑟转向优先股吸引投资者
item.description: 德国电信公司 Deutsche Glasfaser 在其 10 亿欧元（12 亿美元）的筹资过程中，正在寻求以更好的条件吸引投资者，而在此之前，该公司最初的普通股筹资努力曾一度失败。【原文：German telecommunications company Deutsche Glasfaser is seeking to lure investors with better terms in its €1 billion ($1.2 billion) fundraising process, after an initial push to raise common equity fell flat.】

item.title: 你所有的 "ZIRP 时代 "言论现在听起来都很可笑
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 高能效芯片制造商 Ambiq Micro 申请在美国上市
item.description: 随着科技公司努力应对人工智能计算带来的功耗挑战，超低功耗半导体制造商 Ambiq Micro Inc.【原文：Ambiq Micro Inc., a maker of ultra-low power semiconductors, has filed for an initial public offering as tech companies try to address the power consumption challenges posed by artificial intelligence computing.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行称 Rivian 和 Lucid 将受益于特朗普税收法案
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas）认为，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的税收和支出法案终止了电动汽车税收抵免，电动汽车制造商将从中受益，因此Rivian Automotive Inc.和Lucid Group Inc.的股价周四分别上涨了4.6%和8.8%。【原文：Shares of Rivian Automotive Inc. and Lucid Group Inc. gained as much as 4.6% and 8.8%, respectively, on Thursday as BNP Paribas sees the EV makers benefiting from President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill ending electric vehicle tax credits.】

item.title: 克里姆林宫加强战争控制，俄罗斯互联网中断率飙升
item.description: 出于安全原因，俄罗斯经常关闭全国大部分地区的移动互联网连接，这表明克里姆林宫控制大众获取技术的能力在不断增强。【原文：Russia is regularly switching off mobile internet connections in large swaths of the country for security reasons, in a sign of the Kremlin’s growing ability to control popular access to technology.】

item.title: 拉美风险投资活动放缓至接近大流行前的最低水平
item.description: 拉美地区的风险资本交易创下了近七年来最慢的速度，部分原因是全球经济的不确定性和美国投资者在该地区的撤资。【原文：Venture capital dealmaking in Latin America has hit the slowest pace in almost seven years, in part due to global economic uncertainty and a pullback from US investors in the region.】

item.title: 比特币权力大转移导致大量持有者抛售 50 万枚比特币
item.description: 一场无声的控制权转移正在重塑价值 2.1 万亿美元的比特币市场。【原文：A silent transfer of control is reshaping the $2.1 trillion Bitcoin market.】

item.title: CoreWeave 从戴尔获得首批新型高端 Nvidia AI 芯片
item.description: CoreWeave 公司表示，该公司已收到市场上首个基于最新高端 Nvidia 公司芯片的人工智能服务器系统，这标志着该公司在竞争激烈的人工智能云计算领域的地位不断提升。【原文：CoreWeave Inc. said it has received the market’s first artificial intelligence server system based on the newest, high-end Nvidia Corp. chip, a sign of its rising stature in the competitive AI cloud-computing space.】

item.title: 美联储博斯蒂克敦促在不确定性中保持耐心，实现经济复苏
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）呼吁在经济政策的不确定性中保持耐心，并表示观望态度有助于确保官员们不必在利率问题上扭转方向。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic called for patience amid uncertainty over economic policy and said a wait-and-see approach can help to ensure officials don’t have to reverse course on interest rates.】

item.title: 中国承诺加强对落后太阳能行业的监管
item.description: 中国政府誓言要加强对陷入困境的太阳能产业的监管，该产业因产能过剩导致价格下降而蒙受了数十亿美元的损失。【原文：The Chinese government vowed to increase oversight of the nation’s beleaguered solar industry, which has suffered billions of dollars in losses as an over-abundance of manufacturing capacity slashes prices.】

item.title: 马来西亚国家石油公司与 Venture Global 签署第二份液化天然气协议
item.description: 马来西亚能源公司 Petroliam Nasional Bhd.（简称 Petronas）与 Venture Global Inc.签订了一项为期 20 年的液化天然气供应新协议，标志着美国出口商签订了一项重要的销售和采购协议。【原文：Malaysian energy company Petroliam Nasional Bhd., known as Petronas, has signed a new 20-year deal for liquefied natural gas supply from Venture Global Inc., marking a significant sales and purchase agreement for the US exporter.】

item.title: 就业数据强劲，波动率指标徘徊在四个月最低点附近
item.description: 周四早盘，Cboe VIX 指数触及四个多月来的最低水平，此前显示美国劳动力市场好于预期的就业数据推动了股市的反弹，使股市创下历史新高。【原文：The Cboe VIX Index touched its lowest level in more than four months in early trading Thursday, after jobs data showing the US labor market is doing better than expected added to a rally that has pushed stocks to records.】

item.title: 打击贩毒集团资金令墨西哥银行因制裁而惶恐不安
item.description: 在墨西哥太平洋沿岸的一个豪华度假村，银行高管们在五月份的年度会议上遇到了一位不速之客。美国财政部的一位高级官员专程飞来参加这次盛会，并发出了严厉的警告。【原文：Top bank executives gathered at a luxury resort off Mexico’s Pacific coast encountered an unexpected guest at an annual convention in May. A high-level official with the US Treasury Department had flown down to the soiree — where rooms ran as much as $900 a night — to deliver a firm warning.】

item.title: 尽管有疲软迹象，就业报告还是减轻了美联储的压力
item.description: 6 月份就业报告的头条数据减轻了美联储本月晚些时候考虑降息的压力，很可能使央行至少在秋季之前按兵不动。【原文：Headline numbers from the June jobs report took pressure off the Federal Reserve to consider an interest-rate cut later this month, likely leaving the central bank on hold at least until the fall.】
